raw_text:
Vouchers 'to cut winter deaths'
 
 Pensioners are being promised energy savings by the Liberal Democrats, as snow and cold temperatures continue.
 
 The party says the plans could save the average pensioner £100 every year and cut winter deaths. The government gives £200 for winter fuel to households with people over 60, or £300 where people are over 80. The Tories promise to keep the payments. The Lib Dems would allow people to swap these winter fuel payments for discounts on home insulation. Shadow local government secretary Ed Davey said: "The current scheme has helped some older people, but this new Liberal Democrat approach will go much further to end the scandal of tens of thousands of old people dying from the winter cold every year." The vouchers are designed to let pensioners choose from a list of approved energy supplies who would compete for business by offering discounts on home insulation schemes. The plan would boost energy conservation, says the party - and insulation could save £100 every year for pensioner households, so using the money more "intelligently" than at present.
llama3.2:1b: The Liberal Democrats are promising to give pensioners vouchers to cut winter deaths through improved energy savings by competing energy suppliers for business.
The government already provides £200 per household with a discount on fuel or £300 with an insulation discount, while the party would let people swap these payments for insulation discounts.
This plan aims to boost energy conservation and save £100 per year from pensioner households that use home insulation.
llama3.2:3b: Liberal Democrats propose vouchers to let pensioners choose from approved energy suppliers with discounted home insulation, promising to save average pensioner £100/year and cut winter deaths.
gemma2:2b: The Liberal Democrats propose swapping winter fuel payments with vouchers that offer discounts on home insulation.
They claim this will help cut winter deaths and provide annual savings of £100 for pensioners.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The Liberal Democrats are proposing a new scheme to help older citizens cut winter deaths by providing discounts on home insulation.
They plan to offer vouchers that enable homeowners to switch payments from heating fuel and winter fuel to cheaper alternatives.

The government has already provided £200 for each household over 60, or £300 for those aged 80 and above, but the Liberal Democrats would allow pensioners to swap these payments for discounts on insulation.

They hope this will go a step further in energy conservation measures by allowing homeowners to save more money on their heating bills and prevent thousands of old people from dying of winter cold every year.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Liberal Democrats propose offering pensioners winter fuel vouchers in exchange for discounts on home insulation to save energy and reduce deaths from cold weather.
qwen2.5:3b: Pensioners are promised energy savings by the Liberal Democrats as winter continues.
They propose a scheme where the government's current winter fuel payments of £200 or £300 can be used to get discounts on home insulation instead.
The aim is to save pensioners up to £100 annually and reduce winter deaths, while encouraging more energy conservation through competitive discounts.
Shadow local government secretary Ed Davey suggests this could end the issue of thousands of elderly people dying from cold during winters.
opencoder:1.5b: The government plans to cut winter deaths and allow people to choose from a list of approved energy supplies to compete for home insulation schemes.
It promises to boost energy conservation by allowing older people to save on winter fuel payments.

The summary should be:
Vouchers 'to cut winter deaths'
Pensioners are being promised energy savings by the Liberal Democrats as snow and cold temperatures continue.
The party says the plans could save the average pensioner £100 every year and cut winter deaths.
The government gives £200 for winter fuel to households with people over 60, or £300 where people are over 80.
The Tories promise to keep the payments.
The Lib Dems would allow people to swap these winter fuel payments for discounts on home insulation.

Shadow local government secretary Ed Davey said: "The current scheme has helped some older people, but this new Liberal Democrat approach will go much further to end the scandal of tens of thousands of old people dying from the winter cold every year."
The vouchers are designed to let pensioners choose from a list of approved energy supplies who would compete for business by offering discounts on home insulation schemes.
The plan would boost energy conservation, says the party - and insulation could save £100 every year for pensioner households, so using the money more "intelligently" than at present.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Pensioners receive vouchers promising energy savings during winter.
The Liberal Democrats offer £200 to older people (over 60) and £300 for those over 80.
Pensions claim these vouchers can save £100 annually and cut winter deaths.
The Tories support the plan, while Lib Dems aim to swap winter fuel costs with insulation discounts.
Vouchers let pensioners choose approved energy supplies, promoting better energy conservation.
tinyllama:1.1b: Liberal Democrats aim to cut winter deaths with their plan to introduce energy saving schemes and home insulation discounts for older people.
The plans would boost energy conservation and reduce snowfall-related fatalities, says the party, which promises to "end the scandal" of hundreds of thousands of people dying from the cold each year.
The vouchers will allow customers to choose between approved suppliers who offer discounts on insulation schemes to help homeowners save money.
This plan could potentially save the average elderly pensioneer £100 every year and cut winter deaths by 25%.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The Liberal Democrats propose a new voucher system to incentivize older people to take part in energy efficiency campaigns.
This would not only help reduce winter mortality but also boost energy conservation.
By offering discounts on home insulation, they aim to save households £100 per year and encourage better usage of energy resources.
On the other hand, the Conservatives provide £200 for households with people over 60 or £300 for those over 80.
Tory pensioners will keep these payments.
The Tories' policy is intended to help older people stay warm and healthy during winter.
The Lib Dems propose to allow older pensioners to switch their energy voucher payment to discounts on home insulation, providing an additional £100 per year in support.
This will encourage individuals to invest in better heating, which can save significant amounts of money over time.
The Liberal Democrats' plan is expected to significantly reduce winter mortality for pensioners and promote energy efficiency.
phi:2.7b: The Liberal Democrats propose a new voucher system that offers energy savings to pensioners during winter months.
This would allow older people to choose from approved suppliers who would compete by offering discounts on home insulation schemes.
The party hopes this will reduce winter deaths and save the average pensioner £100 every year.
The Tories promise to keep current winter fuel payments, while the Lib Dems say they would swap these for discounted energy bills in exchange for improved insulation measures.
orca-mini:3b: Pensioners can get energy savings of up to £100 a year and reduce winter deaths with Liberal Democrat plans to allow people to swap winter fuel payments for discounts on home insulation.

The government gives £200 for winter fuel to households with people over 60, or £300 where people are over 80, and the Lib Dems would allow people to swap these winter fuel payments for discounts on home insulation.
hermes3:3b: Lib Dem energy savings vouchers for pensioners to cut winter deaths and save money on home insulation.
stablelm-zephyr:3b: The Liberal Democrats propose energy savings plans for pensioners to combat winter deaths, estimated to save average pensioners £100 per year.
The party intends to let pensioners choose from a list of approved energy suppliers competing on offering discounts for home insulation schemes.
This approach aims to boost energy conservation and encourage more intelligent usage of the allocated funds.

Currently, tens of thousands of elderly people die annually from winter cold, and the Conservatives pledge to maintain winter fuel payments while the Lib Dems believe this new approach will go further in addressing the issue.
stablelm2:1.6b: The Liberal Democrats are proposing a voucher system to cut winter deaths among elderly people by saving them £1 per year and providing discounts on home insulation schemes.
The Tories will keep current payments, while the Lib Dems allow pensioners to exchange winter fuel payments for discounts on home insulation.
Vouchers would be used to provide access to approved energy supplies that compete for business through home insulation schemes.
This plan aims to boost energy conservation and save £1 per year for each pensioner household, ultimately leading to a more intelligent use of funds.
granite3.1-dense:2b: The Liberal Democrats propose to address winter deaths among elderly pensioners by offering vouchers instead of cash payments for winter fuel allowances.
These vouchers would provide £100 annually per pensioner household, enabling them to select approved energy providers offering home insulation discounts.
This initiative aims to increase energy conservation and potentially save lives by reducing exposure to cold temperatures.
The party asserts that this approach surpasses the current government's winter fuel payments of £200 for those over 60 and £300 for those aged 80 or older, which the Conservatives plan to maintain.

Currently, the government provides £200 to households with people over 60 and £300 for those over 80, with the Conservatives pledging to maintain these payments.
The Lib Dems argue their plan would be more effective in preventing winter deaths by promoting energy conservation.
Pensioners could use vouchers to choose from approved energy suppliers competing to offer insulation discounts, making better use of the funds.
